intro: Euphrasia gibbsiae f. comberi, commonly known as the Comber's eyebright, is a variant of the eyebright plant native to the British Isles. It is a low-growing perennial herb characterized by its small, yellowish-orange flowers and hairy, lance-shaped leaves. The plant typically thrives in moist, calcareous soils and is often found in woodland edges and grassy areas. It belongs to the Scrophulariaceae family and is noted for its medicinal properties, historically used for eye ailments. Its delicate appearance and specific habitat requirements make it a rare and ecologically significant species.
